Grant letters will contain a minimum of conditions which upon accept¬
ance by the grantee will consummate the grant. Acceptance of the grant
by the grantee should be indicated by an authorized official of the insti¬
tution signing a copy of the grant letter in the space provided and re¬
turning this copy to the New Educational Media Branch, Office of Education,
Department of Health, Education, and Welfare, Washington 25, D. C.
Payments
The first payment on a grant will be made within approximately two
weeks after receipt by the Office of Education of the signed letter of
acceptance. Subsequent payments will be made quarterly, semi-annually,
or otherwise, as designated on the dates specified in the grant letter.
Where future support is contingent on subsequent appropriations by Congress,
grantees will be informed by letter of the additional amounts authorized
and the dates on which payments of the funds will be made.
No invoices for payment need be submitted by the grantee inasmuch
as payments will be made automatically in accordance with the schedule
indicated in the grant letter.
If, during the life of the grant, fiscal reports indicate that the
actual rate of expenditure will deviate materially from the estimated
rate, the Office of Education may consider it desirable to reschedule the
remaining payments. In this event, the opinion of the grantee will be
sought regarding the contemplated adjustment and, on the basis of such
information, a change in the schedule may be made. Conversely, the Office
of Education will at any time be glad to consider a request initiated by
the grantee for a revised schedule of payments.
Checks will be made payable to the grantee institution, attention
Fiscal Officer. The grant number will appear on each check immediately
following the address of the grantee.
Any funds paid to the grantee in excess of the actual cost of the
research conducted under and chargeable to the Office of Education grant
must be returned by check to the U. S. Office of Education. Such repay¬
ment should accompany the final fiscal report.
Accounts and Records
The grantee shall maintain books and records which will show all
costs incurred under the grant, in accordance with generally accepted
accounting principles. The grantee shall, at all reasonable times dur¬
ing the period of the grant and for a period of three (3) years after
final payment under the grant, make available for inspection by authorized
representatives of the Office of Education and the General Accounting
Office, at the office of the grantee, all books, documents, and other
evidence bearing on the income, costs, expenses, and operations of the
grantee in connection with the research conducted under the grant.
